img.alt: EAHS biology class outdoors on the coast

a.span: EAHS Biology students take learning outdoors

div.p: "We're in heaven, dude!" Students find relevance and engagement through LandPaths field trip to the Sonoma County coast.

a.title: Go to comments for EAHS Biology students take learning outdoors

div.p: The Board of education approved a new Mission, Vision and Strategic Plan to last through 2024.

a.title: Go to comments for New Strategic Plan

img.alt: Dr. Kitamura and State Supt. Thurmond

a.span: State Supt. Thurmond meets with local superintendents

div.p: Topics range from recent disasters, to mental health resources and state funding. Click here to read more.

a.title: Go to comments for State Supt. Thurmond meets with local superintendents

div.p: Jazmin Moreno is the 2019-20 Student Board Member. Click here to learn more about the SRCS Board of Education.

a.title: Go to comments for Welcome Jazmin Moreno

div.p: Some of our district's outstanding teachers were recognized for their work. Click here to find a link to their stories.

a.title: Go to comments for Excellence in Education Awards

a.span: SRCS featured in CSEA Focus magazine

div.p: Administrators job-shadowed classified employees, getting an up-close look at what they do. Click here to read more!

a.title: Go to comments for SRCS featured in CSEA Focus magazine

a.span: Kyle Thompson named Teacher of the Month

div.p: Elsie Allen High School's music teacher was surprised in his class by a former student. Click here to read more!

a.title: Go to comments for Kyle Thompson named Teacher of the Month

a.span: Mr. Cassity is on that bus!

div.p: Helen Lehman Elementary teacher is featured among outstanding teachers in a bus campaign. Click here to read more.

a.title: Go to comments for Mr. Cassity is on that bus!

a.span: Extended Hours at College & Career Centers

div.p: These amazing resources are now available to students and families after school. Click here to see the days/hours at your school's center.

a.title: Go to comments for Extended Hours at College & Career Centers

a.span: Our teachers featured in SCOE publication

div.p: Two of our teachers share student engagement strategies. Click to read more.

a.title: Go to comments for Our teachers featured in SCOE publication

div.p: Did you know that our superintendent was recently a student, too? Her university profiled her response to the 2017 wildfires in a recent news article. Click here to learn more.

a.title: Go to comments for Superintendent Kitamura's Leadership Highlighted

img.alt: Children select items from a salad bar at school

div.p: Lunch forms mean more than food. Click here to learn more.

a.title: Go to comments for Online Meal Applications

a.span: Click here to review Collaborative Curriculum Design Units

p.span: From April 23-30, we are inviting the public to provide feedback on this curriculum.

a.title: Go to comments for Click here to review Collaborative Curriculum Design Units

p.span: When we are all counted, we get millions more federal dollars for things like health care and schools in our community. Click here for links.

a.title: Go to comments for Links to the 2020 Census

a.span: School board meeting via video conference

p.span: Due to the Governor's Emergency Executive Order, school board meetings will be video conferences streamed on Facebook live.

a.title: Go to comments for School board meeting via video conference

a.span: 6th graders: Take the Advanced Math 7 test

p.span: Sixth graders who would like to be considered for Advanced Math 7 need to take the DMDA6 test and can take it at home.

a.title: Go to comments for 6th graders: Take the Advanced Math 7 test

div.class: gb footer one right grey flex fd-c jc-fe

div.span: The Santa Rosa City Schools District prohibits, at any district school or school activity, discrimination, harassment, including sexual harassment, intimidation, and bullying, based on actual or perceived race, color, ancestry, nationality, national origin, immigration status, ethnic group identification, ethnicity, age, religion, marital status, pregnancy, parental status, physical or mental disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, or genetic information, medical information or association with a person or group with one or more of these actual or perceived characteristics. This shall apply when applicable, to interns, volunteers, and job applicants. For questions, concerns or complaints, please contact District Equity and Title IX Compliance Officer: (For Students Grades K-6) Anna-Maria Guzman, Assistant Superintendent Teaching & Learning, 707-890-3800 x80302 aguzman@srcs.k12.ca.us; (For Students Grades 7-12) Patty Turner, Director SAFE, 707-890-3800 x80418 pturner@srcs.k12.ca.us; (For Employees) Stacy Spector, Assistant Superintendent Human Resources, 707-890-3800 x80602 rjackson@srcs.k12.ca.us; 211 Ridgway Avenue, Santa Rosa, CA 95401
